#### Documentation for doing Data Analysis and Machine Learning with R and Python 
##### (and other usefull stuff).

&nbsp;

##### R
- [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.had.co.nz), by Garrett Grolemund and Hadley Wickham
- [Advanced R](https://adv-r.hadley.nz), by Hadley Wickham
- [Creating websites in R](http://www.emilyzabor.com/tutorials/rmarkdown_websites_tutorial.html), by Emily C. Zabor
- [R Markdown: The Definitive Guide](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/), by Yihui Xie, J. J. Allaire and Garrett Grolemund

&nbsp;

##### Python 
- [Automate the Boring Stuff with Python](https://automatetheboringstuff.com), by Al Sweigart
- [Natural Language Processing with Python](http://www.datascienceassn.org/sites/default/files/Natural%20Language%20Processing%20with%20Python.pdf), by Steven Bird, Ewan Klein and Edward Loper
- [Introduction to Python for Econometrics, Statistics and Data Analysis](https://www.kevinsheppard.com/files/teaching/python/notes/python_introduction_2019.pdf), by Kevin Sheppard

&nbsp;

##### Python library
- [NLTK](https://www.nltk.org) --- A Natural Language Toolkit for python.
- [Gensim](https://radimrehurek.com/gensim/index.html) --- Doing Topic modelling in python.
- [Scikit-learn](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/) --- Doing Machine Learning in python.
